title: High Quality of Dispute Resolution Regulations
description: In 2024, Togo achieved a remarkable score of 94.59 in the Quality of Regulations for Dispute Resolution, indicating a robust legal framework for resolving disputes efficiently.

title: Strong Environmental Sustainability Policies
description: Togo's CPIA rating for environmental sustainability was 4.5 in 2023, showcasing the country's commitment to maintaining sustainable environmental policies.

title: Limited Benefit Incidence of Social Safety Nets to the Poorest
description: In 2021, only 2.99% of total safety net benefits reached the poorest quintile in Togo, highlighting a significant gap in social safety net distribution.

title: Low Female Representation in Tertiary Education Staff
description: As of 2021, only 6.1% of academic staff in Togo's tertiary education institutions were female, indicating a gender imbalance in higher education.

title: Low Access to Diarrhea Treatment for Children
description: In 2017, only 13.6% of children under five in Togo received Oral Rehydration Salts (ORS) packets for diarrhea treatment, reflecting limited healthcare access.

title: Scarcity of Technicians in Research and Development
description: With just 3.62 technicians per million people in 2018, Togo faces a shortage of skilled personnel in research and development sectors.
